page.title: 04 FOLKESTONE: HOUSING
page.content: Folkestone has a wide variety of housing, from the fishermen's cottages down by the harbour to the large Victorian and Edwardian villas in the west end of the town. Many old properties in the harbour area have been demolished and replaced with modern flats, but there are still great numbers of semi-detached and terraced houses there. At the opposite end of town many large villas were divided up into flats after World War Two when the servant class virtually disappeared. Smaller post-war houses were built in the area close to Folkestone West station, designed to be spacious but easily run. The location of the town between the North Downs and the sea has inevitably restricted the spread of housing, but even now space is being found for new housing developments.
